alert.note: Alert for Clark (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 4:31PM EST until further notice by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester, Pinchem, Ruckerville, Haggard, Hunt, Agawam, Pilot View, Bloomingdale, Lyndale and Flanagan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
